subject: Microsoft 365 sign-in from new device
body:
Hi Sarah,

We noticed a sign-in to your Microsoft 365 account from a new device.

Sign-in details:
- Device: iPhone (iOS 17.3)
- Location: San Francisco, CA, United States
- Date and time: March 17, 2024, 9:15 AM PST
- App: Outlook Mobile

If this was you, no action is needed. If this wasn't you, please secure your account.

Review recent activity: https://account.microsoft.com/security

Best regards,
Microsoft Account Team

safety_factors: Links to official Microsoft account pages
No urgent threats or pressure tactics
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Perfect example of legitimate security notification - uses real name, specific details, official domain, and professional tone without creating panic.
verification_tips: Verify the sign-in actually occurred in your recent activity
Check if you recognize the device and location
Official Microsoft emails always use microsoft.com domain
Look for specific technical details rather than vague warnings

subject: Your order #112-7894563-1234567 has shipped
body:
Hello John Smith,

Your order has shipped and is on the way.

Order Details:
- Order #: 112-7894563-1234567
- Shipped: March 16, 2024
- Carrier: UPS
- Tracking: 1Z999AA1234567890
- Estimated Delivery: March 18, 2024

Items in this shipment:
- JavaScript: The Definitive Guide (Paperback) - $34.99

You can track your package or manage your orders in Your Account.

Track your package: https://www.amazon.com/gp/css/order-history

Thanks for shopping with us!
Amazon Customer Service

safety_factors: Links to official Amazon account pages
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Excellent example of legitimate e-commerce communication - personalized, detailed, and uses official domains with no urgency tactics.
verification_tips: Verify order number exists in your Amazon account
Check that you actually made this purchase
Confirm tracking number with UPS directly
Amazon always uses amazon.com for order notifications

subject: Weekly digest for Tech Team workspace
body:
Hi Alex,

Here's what happened in your Tech Team workspace this week:

ðŸ”¥ Most Active Channels:

ðŸ“Ž Recent Files:

Manage your notification preferences anytime in your account settings.

The Slack Team

safety_factors: Detailed workspace statistics that can be verified
Links to legitimate Slack application URLs
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Shows how legitimate automated emails provide verifiable, specific information about your actual account activity.
verification_tips: Verify you're actually a member of this workspace
Check if channel names match your actual workspace
Confirm recent activity aligns with your usage
Slack notifications always come from slack.com

subject: Dropbox Business invoice for March 2024
body:
Hello,

Your Dropbox Business invoice is ready for the March billing period.

Invoice Summary:
- Invoice #: INV-2024-03-19-789456
- Billing Period: March 1-31, 2024
- Plan: Business Plus (5 users)
- Amount: $60.00
- Payment Method: â€¢â€¢â€¢â€¢ 4567 (Visa ending in 4567)
- Due Date: April 2, 2024

To view your complete invoice with itemized charges:
View Invoice: https://www.dropbox.com/business/billing

Questions about your bill? Contact our Business Support team at support@dropbox.com

Thank you for your business,
Dropbox Business Team

safety_factors: Legitimate payment method display (partial card number)
Links to official Dropbox business portal
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Demonstrates legitimate business billing communication with proper formatting, realistic amounts, and official contact information.
verification_tips: Verify you have an active Dropbox Business subscription
Check that billing amounts match your plan
Confirm payment method matches your records
Login directly to Dropbox to verify invoice details

subject: Payment received - Transaction ID: 8XY47291JK5623847
body:
Hello Maria Garcia,

You've received a payment.

Transaction Details:
- Amount: $450.00 USD
- From: David Wilson (david.wilson@client.com)
- Transaction ID: 8XY47291JK5623847
- Date: March 20, 2024
- Time: 2:25 PM PST
- Note: "Payment for March consulting services"

This payment has been added to your PayPal balance. You can transfer it to your bank account or use it for purchases.

View transaction details: https://www.paypal.com/myaccount/transactions

If you have questions about this payment, you can contact the sender directly or visit our Resolution Center.

Thank you for using PayPal,
PayPal Customer Service

safety_factors: Specific transaction ID and realistic details
Links to official PayPal account pages
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Perfect example referenced in training - shows legitimate paypal.com vs suspicious misspellings. Professional tone with verifiable transaction details.
verification_tips: Verify transaction appears in your PayPal account
Check that sender information matches expected client
Confirm transaction ID exists in your payment history
Always look for exact paypal.com spelling (not paypaI.com or similar)
